oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Brown County Bluegrass Festival - Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys - 1968-11-10 - part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part two of various performances at the Brown County Jamboree Bluegrass Festival, located in Bean Blossom, Indiana, featuring Bill Monroe (performer) and his Bluegrass Boys, Roland White (guitar), Vic Jordan (banjo), Kenny Baker (fiddle), Jim Monroe (bass), as well as Gordon Terry (performer), Hylo Brown (performer), Ralph Stanley (performer), and Roger Smith (performer). Recorded on November 10, 1968.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bill Monroe; Bluegrass Boys; Hylo Brown; Vernon McQueen; Ralph Stanley; Gordon Terry; Roger Smith
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Bill Monroe thanks the audience, and introduces Hylo Brown -- (00:23) Little Cabin Home On The Hill (Hylo Brown, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys -- (03:05) Monroe thanks the audience, and introduces Vernon McQueen -- (03:36) Sweetheart, You Done Me Wrong (Vernon McQueen, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (06:15) Monroe thanks the audience, and introduces Gordon Terry, Ralph Stanley, and Roger Smith -- (07:17) Little Talk With Jesus (Ralph Stanley, Gordon Terry, Roger Smith, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (09:17) Monroe talks about this being the first time all the performers have sang together, and introduces the next tune -- (09:46) On My Way Back To The Old Home (Ralph Stanley, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (12:00) Monroe talks and Stanley introduces the next tune -- (12:34) True Life Blues (Ralph Stanley, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (15:05) Monroe thanks the audience, and talks about playing with Terry many years ago -- (16:48) Boil Them Cabbage Down (Gordon Terry, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Mountain Boys) -- (20:05) Monroe thanks the audience, and talks about the closing the first show, but talks about the second show -- (21:06) Uncle Pen (Gordon Terry, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Mountain Boys) -- (23:23) Monroe thanks all performers and audience -- (23:48) Y'all Come (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (24:50) Closing statements (Bill Monroe) -- (25:00) [Unidentified] introduces Bill Monroe -- Monroe talks and introduces the first tune -- (25:32) Virginia Darlin' (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (28:16) Monroe introduces the next tune -- (28:26) The Gold Rush (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (31:15) Monroe talks and introduces the next tune -- (31:38) Christmas Time's A Comin' (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (33:48) Monroe introduces Gordon Terry -- (34:25) Orange Blossom Special (Gordon Terry, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (36:14) Monroe thanks Terry, and introduces the next tune -- (36:36) Four Walls (Gordon Terry, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (38:45) Monroe introduces the next tune -- (39:07) Uncle Pen (Gordon Terry, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (41:18) Monroe takes requests from the audience -- (41:35) Summertime Is Past And Gone (Gordon Terry, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (43:55) Monroe introduces the next tune -- (44:04) Roanoke (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (46:45) Wayfaring Stranger (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (50:50) Monroe thanks the audience and introduces Ralph Stanley -- (52:07) On My Way Back To The Old Home (Ralph Stanley, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (55:00) Monroe thanks the audience and introduces the next tune -- (55:35) Lonesome Road Blues (Ralph Stanley, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (58:59) Monroe introduces Hylo Brown -- (59:32) Travelin' Down This Lonesome Road (Hylo Brown, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys)
